law.catch_line: Records of orders, rules, and regulations -- Admissibility and presumptions as evidence.
law.text: The state fire marshal shall keep a permanent record of all summary orders, orders, rules, and regulations. Each such summary order, order, rule, or regulation shall be admissible in any prosecution for the violation of any of its provisions. Provisions of a summary order or an order, rule, or regulation shall be presumed to be lawful and to fix a reasonable and proper requirement and standard of safety from fire loss.
law.history: Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 305, sec. 14, effective June 17, 1978. -- Created 1954 Ky. Acts ch. 201, sec. 16.
